id: Ben Affleck and Jennifer Garner head to church with kids after finalising divorce
paragraph: 135.6m sharesBen Affleck and Jennifer Garner brushed aside their divorce to spend quality time as friends this weekend.The former couple, who signed divorce papers earlier in October, were spotted heading to church on Sunday morning with their children.Proving they are on amicable terms, Jennifer, 46, and the Batman actor led two of their three children, Seraphina, nine and Samuel, six, into the church service in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles together as a family.It appears their eldest daughter Violet, 12, decided to skip the service on this occasion as she wasn’t pictured with the group.Ben wrapped his arm around his youngest daughter, Seraphina, while Jennifer arrived separately looking chic in a black top teamed with a grey and brown skirt with beige heels.The family outing comes just hours after Ben, 46, and Jen, together attended Game 4 of the MLB series between the Los Angeles Dodgers and the Boston Red Sox on Saturday.Sitting on the suite level at the Dodger Stadium, Ben chatted to a male friend while Jen caught up with American Horror Story actress Angela Bassett.It’s been a busy weekend for Jen as an insider reportedly told Us Weekly that the Dallas Buyers Club star had plans to meet her new boyfriend, John Miller, later that evening.Earlier this week, the publication claimed that Jen and John, CEO of CaliGroup, have been quietly dating for six months but things are getting serious between the pair.One source said: ‘It’s getting pretty serious,’ while another insider added: ‘Jen brings out the best in John, and he is the happiest he has probably ever been. It’s a loving, healthy relationship.’Jennifer Garner is all smiles as she steps out with new boyfriend John MillerBen Affleck and Jennifer Garner celebrate divorce being made official with family outingBen Affleck and Jennifer Garner’s divorce is officially finalised 'without prenup'Jen and Ben separated in 2015 after almost 10 years of marriage and it’s believed their divorce will be made official before the end of the year, after they signed court papers with a private judge.Ben is currently on a sobriety journey after successfully completing a 40-day rehab stint to battle his alcohol addiction.
